title: Grades 8, 9, 10, 11, 12
subject: CTE: Education, Child Development, and Family Services

document.title: CTE Model Curriculum Standards: Education, Child Development, and Family Services

DCE26BE3F2A64FBCAF656B73546F71EC.description: Plan, conduct, and evaluate social, recreational, and educational activities appropriate to the physical, psychological, cultural, and socioeconomic needs of individuals and families.

35E613E3A2C94F7D8FBE18D8ED1013F1.description: Recommend appropriate community resources for social, recreational, and educational activities to meet client needs for all ages.

D192730773F34D4EBC29666086F09B61.description: Locate and evaluate the appropriateness of facilities and community resources for social support, recreational, and educational activities.

3D85BC34FC8B4431A603621AB12F621F.description: Defend the value of social, recreational, and educational activities for all ages.

F9EFFB45F3A6480AA7A638865CC6F33D.description: Advocate for the importance of social involvement for individuals and families.

D817B31A80BC4907BD2AE34E5A0303F8.description: Demonstrate how to provide the information that individuals and families need to make decisions about seeking professional help.

2AEC0984456B4578801B9234571D7D4B.description: Explain behaviors that require intervention and outside assistance.

FAD912EB0DA647DD9CD34BEDAA81B2C9.description: Summarize the signs of emotional and physical abuse, emotional crises, and mental health issues, such as depression, isolation, substance abuse, stress, elder abuse, financial abuse, and neglect.

7D15F39A45B64D75B2CA38ECA042CDE8.description: Distinguish common problems and crises affecting individuals and families of all ages.

7BB0244A059A4DCB87DCC046EAD5F0DF.description: Experiment with important consumer information, such as comparison shopping, disclosure on labels, warranties and guarantees, consumer fraud and identity theft, consumer redress, and consumer rights and responsibilities.

0F08E9443C0C49BBB3FFF76B1C233D01.description: Research the various types of disabilities, potential barriers, and types of accommodations needed for clients.

341FA58E813748EB8499B0072D339E80.description: Develop procedures for shopping, banking, recordkeeping, and other services that will assist clients.

DEF3BDA61DB6426D834A79259F3E29A0.description: Demonstrate the importance of privacy, independence, dignity, confidentiality, and respect for clients.

1F49B61961C84709B567E8C4189100D0.description: Understand the importance of personal care and well-being to the physical and emotional health of clients.

16EF1759727246E9AB7E6245D63C4DED.description: List the tasks of daily living and the types of assistance persons need with these activities, including assistance for persons with special needs.

0FD45DE6553B4488A283C7BBCAAA0FC3.description: Facilitate daily living activities of individuals and families.

A163101608824F7FA7578FC64EF8766B.description: Predict possible causes of behavior problems and conflict and demonstrate positive solutions, including behavior modification.

F682299C25F84FA8BECCE7F47CAE01AC.description: Implement positive guidance techniques that are appropriate for clients and that promote independence.

DCFD73A4A4F84DD4AFE4C645253FEE47.description: Interpret the concept of positive guidance and its benefits across one's life span.

7767C3CB3DA0413AA75E57EAF60C3E21.description: Integrate positive guidance and its application in helping individuals and families.

D1506E4C682F4864A81FD992358F7D31.description: Create effective ways to teach individuals and families communication, mediation, conflict-resolution, and decision-making skills.

62503469CF71422FA403BA8438F7BB9D.description: Apply effective ways to communicate and interact with culturally diverse individuals and families, such as using mediation, conflict resolution, and decision-making skills.

A60BFB3A152E4C12A277358D3F2B0FA4.description: Use the strategies that promote positive interaction between individuals, families, and agencies.

122B649C425744EAB7AE8C9EF4F6843E.description: Develop interpersonal skills required to interact effectively with individuals and families of all ages and abilities.

7A90A2E6E50E40299C156CDDC4863202.description: Comply with the procedures that prevent the spread of illnesses, infections, and diseases, including blood-borne pathogens.

81DB880DAD7C4B238EF14C5E1CD793EE.description: Perform the procedures for basic first aid and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) for infants, children, and adults.

771E9845C20F4BE3A594857F612BF9EA.description: Practice the correct procedures for dealing with emergencies and disasters.

062FC2F23BA04D6B8CDB644C825A3065.description: Identify the specific health considerations of persons with disabilities.

0A2DCFEDF03F4A42959889C67F0134AF.description: Discern the causes and preventions of common accidents and injuries.

0BEC1D61DB4A40FEAA50BE577D457788.description: Recognize how to establish and promote good safety habits for all ages.

9A7F075F28384E58AC0D7F02064491C4.description: Practice important safety, emergency, and disaster procedures to use for a variety of populations.

FCF58235EF894167A7EE048ACAEF8F82.description: Plan and prepare snacks and meals that meet the dietary needs of persons, including those with special dietary needs, by using sanitary and safe food-handling procedures.

A3BDC2D1EE1F49F09911A5C9D1FB94E4.description: Plan and demonstrate exercise activities that are enjoyable, safe, and appropriate for the individual needs of clients.

AB5F0851C4F9475F903036F273B95017.description: Evaluate foods in terms of their economic and nutritional value.

387A01E4C22743E3876140B51775F41B.description: Recognize and describe signs and symptoms of health, illness, discomfort, and disease.

D119770C96AD4029AA64659C35C0EE0B.description: Select strategies that promote good health practices for all ages.

1A95F70271BA440E86247F6A7B88EF0E.description: Apply the basic principles that promote health and well-being throughout the life span.

5B3336C5DFCA4BD38CD18AF9EC53FF02.description: Assess the special needs of clients and identify resources and agencies that provide services.

4027363611E0466E97E9E8995638FD24.description: Diagram the characteristics and changing needs of the various stages of development throughout the life span.

31722958717042179FE8463CCC2976B8.description: Develop ways to enhance the social and emotional health of individuals and families.

A2DD9114E1CA4C879865C2C7BCC6082B.description: Classify common needs, problems, and adjustments associated with life changes.

882F711ADB2E45F19A5A1B315227D248.description: Identify the behaviors and resources that foster the health and well-being of individuals and families.

5170CB6566E54E7AB3CC7D20C4269C62.description: Interpret the stages of human development and the related needs of individuals and families.

D28FA759FED8481497B75B6D51F1B6A4.description: Understand the typical policies and procedures established by employers to comply with local, state, and federal regulations and laws.

BFCCB6A98D5A45D9BAA0EC8A8297208F.description: Identify the ways in which local, state, and federal regulations and laws are enforced by regulatory agencies, including the California Occupational Safety and Health Administration, the Americans with Disabilities Act, and the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act.

4C8B90295D834BCA9BAEC632F3CA22F0.description: Recognize the local, state, and federal laws, regulations, and agencies established to protect children, adolescents, and adults, including older adults and other persons with special needs and abilities.

C3125FBAB1014BDC93539743EB70C48B.description: Adhere to the laws and regulations that affect providers of family and human services and their diverse clients.

A97CC3DCDA8148A9AFE28BD74D42C674.description: Evaluate facilities for the safety, well-being, and needs of diverse clients.

B1688FB91E3A45CF97300CF8A0B6DD96.description: Become familiar with various types of liability, insurance policies, code compliance, service agreements, and contracts.

C367F476F1D4402EA76580DAEE5C7875.description: Describe the operational procedures related to quality control, inventory control, maintenance, storage, security, mailing, receiving, billing, and payment.

1C5C6CB361AB421BAF9BFAB6F29964EC.description: List the various types of care facilities that promote the independence of clients.

8928A0C4E4FE4BAD90BE3B417D68DE7C.description: Locate the facilities and operational procedures used in the family and human services industry.

C5DCB269DF2F4D5FB96105A08AE121E4.description: Create a plan of how to identify and gain access to various sources of funding and services that serve individuals, families, and communities.

DAA914E2329848DD95DAB035B3E073C2.description: Experiment with using organizational procedures and tools, such as business plans, budgets/financials, spreadsheets for payroll and inventories, recordkeeping, and communication with consumers.

442612F51382435389F822A5C4EB5F66.description: Compare the interrelationship, interdependence, and diversity of management and employees as they relate to workforce productivity.

1401AE96F26B4EC78AAA0819B6040A45.description: Practice the main workforce management strategies, such as shared responsibilities, collaboration, consensus-building, and communication.

B241997145914081972DBC7E5365E2A0.description: Define the outcomes of effective leadership and management, such as profitability, solvency, productivity, positive work environment, and client satisfaction.

5ADB83C4D3844E279873055147715DD6.description: Describe the principles of effective workforce and organizational management, including the roles and responsibilities of management and employees.

61EF948F18054B4CBFB9440FB18C3BFC.description: Diagram the organizational structure and hierarchy that shows the relationships and interactions among departments in both public and private sectors of this industry.

377901B37D334456B38F8D24673E8422.description: Explore the legislative, economic, and social trends that have an effect on careers in the family and human services industry.

E3FFA88184344EAA9AE6BCE3BC65CBDE.description: Communicate the role and effect of this industry on individuals, families, and the state's economy.

E0C6CF60162144169E0A266AF148E2F6.description: Describe the ways in which agencies and organizations provide family and human services.

65339769C47E4F0786325345762A7FCD.description: Recognize important aspects of the family and human services industry and the role of the industry in local, state, national, and global economies.

comments: Employment growth in the Family and Human Services pathway will likely be driven by an increasing demand for family assistance. Students learn employment and management skills, such as positive guidance, professional behavior and standards, and laws and regulations related to the field. Students also learn about nutrition, health, aging, and safety.

B8E29D56D02748CC97218A00502DB751.description: Assess the recreational interests and needs of individuals and groups and develop appropriate activities.

F5111A8B09A74EE6A4D537E9FF50D5A5.description: Summarize the important components and typical age-appropriate or ability-appropriate activities of various after-school and recreational programs.

589AE7DA02374DE38834EA537B5C7F0C.description: List the purposes of after-school and recreational activities.

D593E1E58A3F4182A058A3759B040B8D.description: Formulate the components of effective after-school and recreational programs for individuals and groups.

F8EF22C9ED5F42FCA2740721B8CCAC42.description: Research the common typical and atypical learning challenges for students in a variety of curricular areas.

CCA525C24F90422DA2E79517C712B9CE.description: Analyze a variety of individual and group teaching strategies and learning theories that promote effective learning.

863982759139481DB150D0B553752F72.description: Explain how to help the teacher with student instruction, assessment, and confidentiality.

00BACF9DA4F049D2A69D8925B7C37160.description: Demonstrate techniques for providing positive feedback on student work, attendance, and classroom performance.

0F68F70284BC4AECA8BB0DE6270B70E5.description: Name behavior standards expected of students in classrooms, libraries, and bathrooms on the school grounds and during educational and recreational trips.

52A796FAFE8E40FAA3958D700F856FF8.description: Evaluate the role of instructional staff in supporting the learning process.

AEEE04DF810846F2A97C0E212DF66AC8.description: Design grade-appropriate instructional materials and resources, including those that augment educational materials adopted by the State Board of Education.

672D49B7871E4E4AA98255E517158EDF.description: Demonstrate the appropriate use of current and emerging technology to develop instructional materials and support learning.

C021485A485842E78E226275BA0657F3.description: Evaluate various types and sources of quality, developmentally appropriate materials and equipment.

CDDD52A35337468DABC07E44A7489267.description: Integrate the process of developing quality teaching materials and resources for classroom instruction.

C25548ED3E104C27B2CFAE9CA428792D.description: Explain issues of diversity and how to exhibit sensitivity to cultural differences.

A24A040406894D90B074B9F41DE8BCBA.description: Summarize the ways in which age, abilities, language, culture, economics, and educational backgrounds may affect communication within and among families and the school.

08D8E70CF2E54C74BD6D7EC7A35E69CB.description: Recognize the factors that influence effective communication between the school and home and how to foster familial involvement.

CA3C528CB8B442608E7B1FCFA28B5A81.description: Assess how to communicate and interact effectively with families and community groups.

44AC6127F43D40A995AFC218CB7A04C1.description: Identify services available to at-risk students and how to link students to resources.

1073109E902146B7A3AA15325AD21B5F.description: Describe crucial safety and sanitary procedures to follow in the classroom related to good nutrition and health.

9AF93FFB49AC4A2BB5F519A70351FDD2.description: Compare basic principles and practices of good nutrition and health and wellness for children.

47304213A51A41BD9605FB198E370FF5.description: Identify relevant curriculum standards, their significance to student success, and demonstrate their use in instruction.

4D4A0F73C16A4E4886B5C806FA322364.description: Practice using teaching strategies that promote student learning, critical thinking, and problem solving.

465E316B821B4C7CA8485D1EB9D3F076.description: Use the basic components of effective standards-based lesson plans appropriate for varying ages, learning styles, and diverse cultural backgrounds and abilities to write lesson plans.

0F9502F14D6442CEB5F28D78CA95C7D2.description: Understand the types, important elements, and purposes of student assessments.

2BB0686F9E7A480494CA1C74E1F2E1BF.description: Understand the processes, implementations, and educator responsibilities of individualized education programs (IEPs) and Section 504 plans of the Rehabilitation Act and the Americans with Disabilities Act.

58227D7901CA488EB2299FF2F11414F8.description: Identify relevant curriculum standards and demonstrate their use in instruction.

42E471968CBE42B48C244AD86C58415D.description: Explain the role and purpose of standards-based instruction and assessment.

3EDB8294880146C18C98CFC92DACFFCB.description: Develop strategies for building relationships with all stakeholders.

EFA5FE601FF948BCB073E8EC8422B034.description: Practice strategies for building relationships and effective classroom management, including appropriate guidance and discipline.

96050047F66C45D48193E28F628A733A.description: Demonstrate how to support the development of a positive self-image and self-esteem as well as independence and respect for oneself and others.

172587049C5C41B1992D1A5A4946668A.description: Define the types of positive guidance techniques that are used in various ages and stages of a child's development.

DADE3A8A8692453192E2F04FA6791DB8.description: List common behavior problems, possible causes, and develop potential positive solutions.

99134C333E59474CA0427DFB3FE0750C.description: Use positive interaction, guidance, and discipline in the educational environment.

39BBD3B9C09247CE9AE304CA78A958CF.description: Assess and evaluate evidence-based educational practices for the inclusion of children and adolescents with special needs.

3A5DF88F280542A0A4FB34AE52FB1C76.description: Diagram factors in heredity, family, culture, diversity, economic, abilities, and environment that may influence the development of children and adolescents.

2CCA97CA37994AA6A487FE2375953258.description: Explain the role of family involvement in the physical, intellectual, emotional, and social development of children and adolescents.

01F43A5D74EE49DFA7EBC2E3127C2D81.description: Identify how typical and common atypical developmental patterns affect the educational progress of children and adolescents.

734A42782C6D4E73964A79395B3A9425.description: Summarize important elements of the physical, intellectual, emotional, and social development of children and adolescents.

3966734A35D0409CA0D6930F166C9F49.description: Demonstrate how to use certified first aid, cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), and other emergency procedures.

74F97A2F53624B079B77EC9E40B74C9B.description: Describe the staff procedures, duties, and responsibilities related to safety, emergency, and disaster preparedness plans.

3CD9C9B3117C4E3A8206BDC5055BEF73.description: Recognize the typical hazards at the work site and know the procedures and practices that contribute to a safe and healthy environment.

C95056E6A78B42B4BBA553140ECA23B2.description: Identify state and federal environmental and safety regulations and the use of Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) as they relate to the education industry.

203A05217C8D4B34AF5CB315FBD83515.description: Practice critical emergency and disaster procedures at a school site.

78C33265C4D44509AC011F6BDE3A04AF.description: Locate and understand the credentialing requirements for teachers of students in prekindergarten through community college.

1245B2EA45F8447F8DDD315D031E8DC7.description: Identify the indicators of child abuse and neglect and the role of the mandated reporter.

5DC09DF690ED4750BFA4BD9983A30FC8.description: Describe the critical health and safety procedures that are used at a school site.

0BD4D6D048A84A6B9C982A4E7A2B0ADF.description: State specific applications of government regulations in the education industry.

7A59EE86B7D24FE1826BC152F2AD84E1.description: Implement appropriate procedures at the classroom level (e.g., attendance; observations; evaluations; illness, incident, accident, and injury reports).

4B43BB48E84448A487911A61CF7FAAFC.description: Recognize the main workforce management strategies in education (e.g., shared responsibility and negotiation).

DD0B213FB056487FAC6428D5D7F63049.description: Identify the business procedures related to the acquisition of supplies and collection of fees.

C767EC0F95474B758FDCE29200BBB929.description: Name operational procedures and organizational policies at various levels in education.

19B4A477493346A18C78BFA1F9FE3708.description: Explain the differences in organizational structures at educational facilities, including relationships and interactions among personnel.

45C0AAB7B1344AFBA3F04B397266E2BA.description: Understand the legislative, economic, and social trends that affect the education industry.

90E9CA76ED884A1696465E2A2B9B4C43.description: Describe the basic structure of public education in California (e.g., prekindergarten through grade twelve, community college, the California State University, the University of California), as well as private institutions.

3258F2B9780142FE976B4BD50EB108F5.description: Identify the effect of the education industry on state and local economies.

0D4E08A79F7F444B8916C84F9FFA66AD.description: Describe the structure of the education industry and its role in local, state, and global economies.

comments: The Education pathway is designed to prepare students for professional or learning support positions in education, prekindergarten through grade twelve. Students study human development; standards, regulations, and codes; positive guidance and counseling techniques; age-appropriate and grade-appropriate learning strategies; learning theories; and standards-based curriculum and instructional design. Students can apply and practice their knowledge and skills at a variety of elementary and secondary education sites.

8FF3A0F60FAE4FACAF4C4FF6822163EC.description: Review Truth in Lending legislation and California's Rosenthal Act related to consumers and their rights.

5CA8F1CA78034CE6B5F80F0F6120DFB3.description: Compare the services provided by various financial institutions and departments of government.

DA5F3D4ED21445DB8E883C9BAF3E8F28.description: Explain inflation and recession and how they affect the financial status of individuals and families.

00C476E33A1F48A4B6F5103A92085B14.description: Describe the interrelationship between the economy and consumer spending and saving.

8CB89809DF23425BB0FCD730EB0A90E0.description: Explore the effect of the U.S. economic system on personal income, financial management, individual and family security, and consumer decisions.

F2C6A7CE6E274546B014F23392BEC5D4.description: Analyze, describe, and contrast various types of investments and risk assessment programs.

0E8AD88A7A9046C68A514DA1D110EA7E.description: Analyze budgets for a variety of individuals and families in accord with estimated income, needs, desires, goals, and lifestyles.

65DA4795031D460091A3E7D4D5882168.description: Illustrate the costs of bankruptcy to the individual, the consumer, the institution, and the economy.

906DE0B8297F46EAA4AF62FDB237C86A.description: Identify ways to resolve credit issues and explain the effect of credit issues on the consumer and the economy.

8EA1F1E439D24BBDA35C2F4F18675DF7.description: Describe the effects of short-term and long-term financial plans on consumer decisions.

99BA6688F9EB49218905C9F28400D47E.description: Practice personal financial management, its effects on the economy, and career, personal, and family goals.

32B8548231434401BB19D9BA1B044C7D.description: Plan, produce, and evaluate demonstrations that educate consumers and promote a variety of products.

92A8A5259ACE4253BE28B806D26BEF91.description: Compare features, benefits, prices, product information, styles, and performance of goods.

5720A17AB2704F62BE24493623CB084A.description: Explain the industry standards and government regulations that require specific information to be included on labels and care instructions.

A739F86450A84A31BC42748519808739.description: Describe the standard testing procedures and strategies used to analyze data and integrate findings to revise products.

08863DDD66384E6EA90CC33E19C26408.description: Describe the purpose and significance of market research before a new product or service is developed and introduced.

3AB1A8ECA5444E06B2B14F918E630541.description: Research the basic procedures required to research, test, label, and demonstrate products to provide information needed by employees, consumers, and clients.

75AF4A8731664C8EB93E0A71E107798C.description: Compare the costs and benefits of consumer programs for consumers, communities, and businesses.

F199CF17377244AC92D94F2263272206.description: Explain the environmental impact of residential and commercial waste disposal and recycling issues.

F99EB9F87B0B49589603257613C985CF.description: Identify the various sources of energy available to consumers and the strategies that improve energy efficiency.

F7737FD00F384D1DA621C04B9C86E10F.description: Summarize important consumer programs and services provided by energy, environmental, and resource management businesses.

F9A20CDFDD954A668388025B2DAA7C12.description: Analyze public relations plans in terms of their effect on customer relations and the operations of an organization.

13272CD84B5440ED86C6F17E113AE057.description: Demonstrate how to prepare and deliver materials and presentations that consumers will understand, such as videos, visual presentations, media kits, public service announcements, and fact sheets.

4AD881D8153E44C0B051812E517345FA.description: Identify the local, state, national, and international agencies, organizations, and media resources that provide current consumer information, including Internet and social media.

67C3614C19334B6E9CBAAFE71418175C.description: Illustrate how the Internet and new technology, including social media, improve communication and facilitate business operations, as well as can harm or improve a business reputation.

C3468E623C4B4BD8955D140E50C97851.description: Discern logical, legal, ethical, and expedient solutions to consumer concerns by empowering employees to resolve consumer issues at the lowest level.

comments: The Consumer Services pathway focuses on a broad-based curriculum designed to prepare students for careers helping customers, including credit counselors, consumer reporters, writers, and consumer affairs directors. Students learn employment, entrepreneurial, and management skills that include business structure; consumer rights and responsibilities; testing and demonstration of products; consumer communications; and energy, environment, and resource management.

comments: The Child Development pathway is designed to prepare students to pursue a career in the field of child care and development for infants, toddlers, and young children. Students study child growth and development, safety and emergency procedures, nutrition and health practices, positive interaction and guidance techniques, learning theories, and developmentally appropriate practices and curriculum activities. Students apply this knowledge in a variety of early childhood programs, such as child development laboratories, public and private preschools, family day care settings, and recreational facilities. Students completing the program may apply for the Child Development Assistant Permit from the California Commission on Teacher Credentialing.

252A2D207974423896E86398851DE97E.description: Create a portfolio, or similar collection of work, that offers evidence through assessment and evaluation of skills and knowledge competency as contained in the anchor standards, pathway standards, and performance indicators.

B148AF472D4E496DBC892874701A07BE.description: Recognize the elements of communication using a senderreceiver model.

comments: Acquire and accurately use Education, Child Development, and Family Services sector terminology and protocols at the career and college readiness level for communicating effectively in oral, written, and multimedia formats.

Analyze and apply appropriate academic standards required for successful industry sector pathway completion leading to postsecondary education and employment. Refer to the Education, Child Development, and Family Services academic alignment matrix for identification of standards.
